image.altText: A man with a yellow checkered shirt walks outside of court surrounded by female journalists holding microphones.

props.synopsis: Kym Parsons, 73, is accused of carrying out 10 bank robberies while he was armed with a rifle in small South Australian towns between 2004 and 2014.

title.children: DNA and bullets from alleged 'bicycle bandit' linked to two robberies, court hears

image.altText: A young man with redish hair and wearing a checked shirt looks out from a balcony.

props.synopsis: Travis Mathews' story has never been made public, until now. He's speaking out about his experience at Sydney's Cranbrook School as part of a Four Corners investigation.

title.children: Former Cranbrook student says he was repeatedly sexually abused at private boys' school

image.altText: An aerial shot of Lake Malbena, half in sunlight, half in shade. A beautiful still lake surrounded by green forests.

props.synopsis: Humans are wreaking havoc on our most cherished places and tourism is a significant and growing contributor to the chaos, writes Linton Besser.

title.children: This island risks being transformed into a consumer experience for the wealthy. Should it be a wake-up call?

image.altText: Michelle Heyman holding hands with another matildas player.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government says the Matildas will face off against China at Adelaide Oval in May, ahead of the 2024 Paris Olympics.

title.children: Matildas to play China at Adelaide Oval in friendly game ahead of Paris Olympics

image.altText: Stroke victim Michelle Hatt posing for a photo outside South Australian Parliament with her parents.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman has come forward as another victim of South Australia's ramping crisis, claiming she was ramped for two and a half hours while presenting with symptoms of a stroke.

title.children: Adelaide woman with stroke symptoms waited hours in ambulance outside hospital

image.altText: Two storey house half-burnt by lithium battery fire

props.synopsis: Two people killed in a Lake Macquarie house fire last week appear to be the state's first casualties from a lithium-ion battery-related blaze, Fire and Rescue NSW (FRNSW) says.

title.children: Two killed in NSW house blaze believed to be state's first recorded lithium-ion battery-related deaths

image.altText: The Yallourn Power station emits a cloud of white vapour.

props.synopsis: With the Coalition interested in replacing retiring coal plants with nuclear reactors, there are just a handful of regions that would be likely candidates under the opposition's yet to be announced plans to go nuclear.

title.children: Five regions shaping up as favoured candidates for nuclear reactors under Coalition plan, as it eyes retiring coal stations

image.altText: A woman in a flowing blue dress arrives at a court building surrounded by cameras

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins and her partner David Sharaz are attending a mediation session with Ms Higgins' former employer, Senator Linda Reynolds.

title.children: Brittany Higgins and David Sharaz attend mediation over Senator Linda Reynolds defamation action

image.altText: Sam Kerr walking along a field.

props.synopsis: Matildas captain Sam Kerr has been charged over alleged racially aggravated harassment of a police officer in London early last year.

title.children: Matildas captain Sam Kerr charged over alleged racially aggravated harassment of police officer

image.altText: Krystal and Anastasia Marshall hug and smile.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of murdering her ex-wife has been recorded on prison phone calls with her male co-accused discussing their need to "stick to the story" and to "pin it" on him, an Adelaide court has heard.

title.children: Prison calls recorded alleged murderers discussing case and 'where certain witnesses live'

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: Former senator Natasha Stott Despoja has been appointed to head South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

title.children: SA's newly announced DV royal commissioner aims to 'eradicate' family, sexual violence

image.altText: Terry Irving in Townsville prison in 1994-95.

props.synopsis: Terry Irving was imprisoned for a crime he didn't commit. Now the justice system will be asked to answer the ultimate question: What's the cost of loss of liberty?

title.children: Terry was jailed for a crime he didn't commit. After 30 years, he'll finally learn the price of freedom

image.altText: A blurred photo of a car with trees in the background

props.synopsis: The Australian Automobile Association's latest report reveals the cost of getting around capital cities and regional centres. We also zeroed in on essentials like fuel and public transport.

title.children: How expensive is travel in each capital city? We ranked the cost of fuel and public transport

image.altText: A woman holds a picture book open and points to the words on a page

props.synopsis: A new book is hoped to battle complacency about Australia's growing rabbit problem by enouraging children to spark conversations with their parents.

title.children: Author treads fine line teaching children that cute little rabbits need to be exterminated

image.altText: A Horizon Power bill, showing the homeowner owes $588

props.synopsis: Australians say they're experiencing heat stroke as they battle power bills amid record heatwaves across the country, a new report by the Australian Council of Social Services finds.

title.children: Cost-of-living stress causing poor health in Australia's most vulnerable, says new report

image.altText: An aerial photograph of a black submarine at the surface of the sea

props.synopsis: As Australians wait for the nuclear-powered subs that come with the AUKUS deal, some defence experts are worried the whole thing could fall apart.

title.children: 'The whole thing will just come apart': Why some defence experts are worried about AUKUS

image.altText: A middle-aged man sitting on a red leather sofa.

props.synopsis: Bert Janssen underwent transplant surgery in June, 1984, at age 17, when he was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy, a heart muscle disease that makes it harder for the heart to function.

title.children: Bert was given six months to live after his heart transplant — he now holds the record for longest-surviving patient

props.synopsis: A team of United Nations experts have reported that there were "reasonable grounds to believe" sexual violence, including rape and gang rape, occurred at several locations during Hamas' October 7 attacks on Israel.

title.children: UN says there are 'reasonable grounds to believe' Hamas committed sexual violence during October 7 attacks

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks at an out of focused Mark Butler.

props.synopsis: Private health insurers are set to raise premiums by just over 3 per cent in April, following a green light from Health Minister Mark Butler.

title.children: Government approves 3.03pc health insurance hike, but bigger insurers to go further

image.altText: Stockmarket

props.synopsis: Healthcare stocks were among the top performers on the ASX today, after the government announced a 3 per cent lift to premiums. Investors continue to pile into gold and bitcoin as the traditional and new hedges against currency devaluation near record highs.

title.children: Health insurers jump on ASX as premiums go up, gold and bitcoin push toward record highs — as it happened

image.altText: Mohammed ben Sulayem, in traditional Arab garments, looking on during a night session of F1.

props.synopsis: The president of motorsport's world governing body is under investigation for allegedly interfering in the race result of a Formula 1 grand prix, according to the BBC.

title.children: FIA president alleged to have interfered in F1 race result

image.altText: Brisbane Broncos' Ezra Mam runs with the ball in the NRL season opener in Las Vegas against the Sydney Roosters.

props.synopsis: Broncos coach Kevin Walters backs his player Ezra Mam, after Mam alleged he was the victim of a racist slur from Roosters opponent Spencer Leniu.

title.children: 'Ezra has every right to be upset': Walters addresses racism allegations as Broncos and Roosters return home

image.altText: Julianne Moore and Nicholas Galitzine

props.synopsis: Julianne Moore and Nicholas Galitzine star as a scheming mother and son duo who conquer Britain's royal court and seduce its king in this saucy historical psychodrama.

title.children: Mary & George is full of sex, scheming and social climbing. But how true is it?

image.altText: A crowd of people walking along a street in a central business district in Melbourne on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: There's a very real possibility that our economic growth will tip into negative territory on Wednesday — and it's precisely why the language has shifted away from Australia's economy being able to achieve its "soft landing", writes Ian Verrender.

title.children: Did the Reserve Bank hit the brakes too hard? Why the economy is heading into reverse

image.altText: A selfie of a man on a street

props.synopsis: A man who police allege sexually assaulted a woman after picking her up in Toowoomba's CBD at the weekend has cried in court after being refused bail.

title.children: 'Other potential victims' come forward after man faces court over alleged rideshare kidnapping

image.altText: On the image's left side Jack Douglas Teixeira, wearing a uniform, takes a selfie. The right side shows a court sketch of him.

props.synopsis: US Air National Guard member Jack Teixeira has been in prison since April last year after leaking documents about the war in Ukraine and other national security secrets.

title.children: Man who leaked Pentagon secrets about Ukraine war agrees to plea deal with at least 11 years' jail

image.altText: The words "Fire and Rescue" on the side of a truck.

props.synopsis: Authorities are shutting down a gas pipeline as investigations begin into a "significant" blaze that flared up this morning.

title.children: Major pipeline fire cuts off gas supply to Queensland city

image.altText: An aerial shot of a school campus with a large oval. It is near Sydney Harbour and in the distance is the CBD skyline.

props.synopsis: As one of the most exclusive boys' schools prepares to go co-ed, women who worked there warn its culture is toxic and needs to change.

title.children: Teachers given fluffy handcuffs, blackmailed and bullied at one of Australia's most exclusive boys' schools

image.altText: Donald Trump

props.synopsis: The US Supreme Court hands Donald Trump a major victory, ruling he cannot be disqualified from running for president under a constitutional clause referencing insurrection.

title.children: Donald Trump wins US Supreme Court fight to remain on ballots ahead of Super Tuesday primaries

image.altText: An elderly man with white hair in a suit points as he speaks into a microphone in front of a large American flag backdrop.

props.synopsis: Democrats and Republicans in 15 states and one US territory will cast their ballots (or caucus) for their choice of presidential candidate on Tuesday. Here's what to look for — and what's at stake.

title.children: What is Super Tuesday? Your guide to the US primary gauntlet that can make or break a presidential candidate

image.altText: A man works on the underbelly of an electric vehicle inside a mechanics' shop.

props.synopsis: A faster uptake of electric vehicles could make an acute shortage of EV repairers even worse without a plan, the industry warns, with more than half of job vacancies in the sector already going unfilled.

title.children: A shortage of EV mechanics could worsen under vehicle efficiency scheme, industry warns

image.altText: Two small children are sitting on a couch in colourful pajamas, watching cartoons on their tablets.

props.synopsis: Toddlers who get more screen time could be learning fewer new words, an Australian study finds, warning parents of the opportunity cost of distracting children with devices.

title.children: Toddlers losing up 1,100 words a day due to screen time and risking language delay, according to study

image.altText: A close up of a plane resting in grass

props.synopsis: A 63-year-old pilot who was involved in a plane crash near Bunbury Airport has died in hospital.

title.children: Aviation authorities investigate fatal crash of 'homemade' plane during maiden voyage

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: court sketch of accused truck driver Brett Michael Russell

props.synopsis: A Melbourne truck driver will stand trial after pleading not guilty to scores of charges stemming from a 2022 crash on the Western Freeway.

title.children: Truck driver to face trial over crash with school bus full of students headed to space camp

image.altText: Composite image of Ellyse Perry mouth agape and a car with a smashed window.

props.synopsis: Organisers should have known better than to put a sponsor's car right in the hitting zone of Ellyse Perry as her Royal Challengers Bangalore took down Alyssa Healy's UP Warriorz.

title.children: Ellyse Perry puts a six through the window of a car in the stands in Twenty20
